#Text=2. Ballastless Track Structure Multilayer Synthetic Aperture Focusing Technique Method
#Text=2.1 .
#Text=SAFT Imaging Method
#Text=The principle of the SAFT imaging method is shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=In a group of ultrasonic transducer arrays , ultrasonic waves are sequentially emitted by one probe .
#Text=The other probes receive ultrasonic waves .
#Text=The received ultrasonic echo signals are processed by DAS .
#Text=Lastly , a reconstructed B-scan image is produced .

#Text=When information such as the position and size of the defects in the object to be measured are unknown , SAFT imaging can be used to calculate the value of all the pixels by traversing the imaging region .
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=, it is assumed that the sensor position is un ( n = 1 , 2 , 3 ... n ) , while the exciting sensor position coordinates are ( xi , zi ) .
#Text=The receiving sensor position coordinates are ( xj , zj ) .
#Text=The position coordinate of any pixel D is ( x , z ) .

#Text=The time delay tij ( x , z ) experienced by the ultrasonic wave is transmitted from the position of the exciting sensor ui and then reaches the position of the receiving sensor uj via point D , as shown in Equation ( 1 ) : ( 1 ) where the ri is given by : and v is the speed at which sound waves travel in the object being measured , i , j = 1,2,3 â€¦ n .

#Text=When the exciting and receiving transducer positions are ui and uj , respectively , the value of any pixel D ( x , z ) can be expressed as Equation ( 2 ) : ( 2 ) where Iij ( x , z ) represents the value of pixel D ( x , z ) when the exciting and receiving transducer positions are ui and uj .
#Text=Sij represents the amplitude envelope of the received signal when the exciting and receiving transducer positions are ui and uj .
#Text=According to Equation ( 3 ) , the value of any pixel can be obtained in the imaging area grid : ( 3 )
#Text=2.2 .
#Text=Multilayer SAFT Imaging Method Based on Ray Tracing Technique

#Text=The SAFT imaging method makes it easier to achieve the ultrasound imaging of a single medium object , while for multilayer structures like ballastless track structures , ultrasound imaging calculations are much more complicated .

#Text=The ultrasonic phenomenon occurs when the ultrasonic wave penetrates the interface between two adjacent layers of multilayer structures , and the sound propagation path at this time is composed of the refracting line segments in each layer .
#Text=According to the conventional SAFT calculation model , the ultrasonic propagation delay is calculated using Equation ( 1 ) .
#Text=For multilayer structures ( especially when the wave velocity of each layer medium is large ) , the calculation of the propagation delay using Equation ( 1 ) will produce a large error .
#Text=The difficulty of SAFT imaging in multilayer structures lies in accurately obtaining the propagation delay of acoustic waves , that is , accurately obtaining the propagation path .
#Text=The ray-tracing technique is one of the effective methods to solve this problem .
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=, Î± is the incident angle of the acoustic wave and Î¸ is the angle of refraction of the acoustic wave .

#Text=The time at which the acoustic wave is refracted from point A through point P and propagates to point B can be expressed by Equation ( 4 ) . ( 4 ) where t is the total delay of the acoustic wave propagating from A to B , v 1 is the speed of sound in the first layer of the medium , and v 2 is the speed of sound in the second layer of the medium .
#Text=The ray-tracing technique is a method to calculate the acoustic wave propagation time according to Snell â€™s law or Fermat â€™s shortest time principle .
#Text=The actual path of soundwave from point a to point B conforms to Snell â€™s Law ( Equation ( 5 ) ) .
#Text=At the same time , according to Fermat â€™s principle , the actual acoustic wave propagation time from point A to point B is the shortest . ( 5 )
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 3

#Text=, in order to calculate the time when the acoustic wave reaches a certain point D of the second layer , firstly , the traversal method is used to find the refraction point that makes the acoustic wave propagation path delay the shortest at the interface of the discrete layer .
#Text=Then the acoustic wave propagation path is segmented by the position of the refraction point , and the ultrasonic propagation is obtained one by one .
#Text=When the propagation delay of the ultrasonic wave in the multilayer structure is accurately obtained , a focused image can finally be obtained according to the DAS algorithm .
#Text=The specific algorithm is as follows :
#Text=Step 1 : Calculate the acoustic wave from the probe ui through point Pk to the pixel point of the refractive time tik of D using Equation ( 6 ) .
#Text=Step 2 : Obtain the time delay ti of the refractive propagation path from Equation ( 7 ) .
